æ¯˜è¿¦å’é¾ç‹, such great nÄga kings as these were at the head.
There were also 84 koá¹­Ä«s of nayutas of nÄga kings.
All came together to that assembly.
At that time, all the nÄga kings rose from their seats.
Each of them adjusted their robes and bared their right shoulders.
They touched their right knees to the ground and joined their palms towards the Buddha.
They then used various immeasurable and boundless asaá¹ƒkhyeyas of
subtle and wonderful incense, flowers, ointments, and powdered incense.
Flower crowns, garments, jeweled banners, pennants, and canopies.
NÄga flower jeweled crowns, pearl necklaces,
jeweled flowers, silk brocades, pearl nets,
and various pendants and streamers covered above the TathÄgata.
They made various kinds of music, clapped their hands and sang praises.
They gave rise to a mind of great sincerity and marvel.
They circumambulated [the Buddha] a hundred thousand times and then stood to one side.
At that time, after the nÄgas had stood to one side, they all made a vow, saying:
May we, with bodies as numerous as the dust motes in the ocean of all worlds,
and with an ocean of the assembly of buddhas and bodhisattvas,
pervade the ocean of all worlds.
Having already passed beyond all the dust motes in the ocean of the four great elements of earth, water, fire, and wind,
all the light and dust-like oceans of forms,
having passed immeasurable, inconceivable, indescribable,
innumerable oceans of bodies,
in each body manifesting immeasurable, innumerable clouds of hands filling the ten directions,
and in each dust mote,
manifesting immeasurable offering clouds filling the ten directions,
using them to make offerings to the oceans of buddhas and bodhisattvas without interruption,
like this, immeasurable, inconceivable, indescribable,
innumerable clouds of Samantabhadra's practice bodies filling the sky, supporting without interruption,
like this, the bodhisattvas' oceans of bodies and clouds,

Namely, clouds of all wheel marks, clouds of all jeweled crowns, clouds of all great bright jewel treasuries, clouds of all fragrant trees, clouds of all incense smoke manifesting various colors, clouds of all music sounds, clouds of all fragrant trees, and so forth, immeasurable and boundless.
Inconceivable, inexpressible, and innumerable.
Such are all the clouds of offering seas, filling the sky and abiding without interruption.
Making offerings, paying respect, honoring, and bowing to the ocean of all buddhas and bodhisattvas.
Again, emitting clouds of oceans of all adornment realms and treasuries of maá¹‡i jewels

Furthermore, clouds of flames from the ocean of all maá¹‡i jewel treasuries, clouds of flames from the ocean of the colors, sounds, smells, tastes, and tactile objects of all buddhas, clouds of flames from the ocean of all jewel flames, clouds of flames from the ocean that fills everywhere with the resounding sound of all buddha-dharmas, clouds of flames from the ocean of lightning that adorns all buddha-lands, clouds of flames from the light of all flower palanquins, clouds of flames from the light of all jewel flutes, clouds of flames from the sound of the appearance of all buddhas in the world teaching sentient beings in the number of eons, clouds of flames from the appearance of the light of all inexhaustible jewel flower garlands to sentient beings, clouds of flames from the light that manifests the adornments of all seats, and so forth, all filled the sky and were upheld without interruption.

Again, clouds of boundless colored light of jewels that are not cut or scattered emerge from the ocean, clouds of the ocean of universal light of all maá¹‡i jewel kings, clouds of the ocean of lightning light of the adornments of all buddha lands, clouds of the ocean of all fragrant light, clouds of the ocean of all adornment light, clouds of the ocean of light of all buddha emanation bodies, clouds of the ocean of light of all jeweled trees and flower garlands, clouds of the ocean of light of all garments, clouds of the ocean of light of all boundless bodhisattva practices and the names of jewel kings, clouds of the ocean of light of all pearl lamps - such things fill the sky and are sustained without interruption.

At that time, after the eighty-four koá¹­Ä«s of nayutas of dragons in the assembly made this vow,
they circumambulated the Buddha three times, bowed their heads in respect, and stood to one side.
At that time, the Buddha told the dragon kings,
You dragon kings should each sit down again.
When the dragon kings heard the Buddha's words,
they each returned to their seats in order and sat down.
At that time, there was a dragon king in the assembly,
named AnantavyÅ«ha-sÄgara-megha-tejorÄja-cchattra.
Among the nÄga kings of this trichiliocosm,
he was the most excellent and great, and had attained irreversibility.
By the power of his original vows, he had taken on the body of a nÄga.
In order to make offerings, pay respects, and bow to the TathÄgata,
and to listen to and accept the true Dharma, he was reborn in this JambudvÄ«pa.
At that time, the nÄga king rose from his seat,
arranged his robes, bared his right shoulder,
placed his right knee on the ground, joined his palms towards the Buddha,
and said, World-Honored One, I now have doubts.
I wish to ask the TathÄgata, the Worthy One, the Perfectly Enlightened One.
If the Buddha allows me, I will dare to ask.
Having said this, he remained silent.
At that time, the World-Honored One said to the nÄga king AnantavyÅ«ha-sÄgara-megha-tejorÄja-cchattra,
Great nÄga king, if you have doubts, I allow you to ask.
I will explain it to you in detail and make you rejoice.
Having said this,
at that time the dragon king Boundless Adorned Ocean Clouds Majestic Wheel Canopy,
immediately addressed the Buddha, saying, Yes, World-Honored One.
How can it cause the dragon kings and others
to eliminate all suffering and attain blissful acceptance?
Having attained blissful acceptance, it will also cause them in this JambudvÄ«pa
to timely bestow sweet rain, causing all trees, forests, medicinal herbs, and seedlings to grow with nourishing flavors.
It will cause all the people of JambudvÄ«pa to experience happiness.
At that time, the World-Honored One, having heard these words,
immediately told the great dragon king Boundless Adorned Ocean Clouds Majestic Wheel Canopy,
Excellent, excellent!
You now benefit those sentient beings
and are able to ask the TathÄgata about such matters.
You, great dragon king, listen attentively, listen attentively, and contemplate it well.
I will explain it to you in detail.
Wheel Canopy Dragon King, I have one Dharma.
If you are able to fully practice this,
it will enable all dragons to eliminate all suffering and attain complete peace and happiness. What is the one method?
It is practicing great kindness.
You great dragon kings, if there are any devas or humans who practice great kindness,
fire cannot burn them, water cannot drown them,
poison cannot harm them, blades cannot injure them,
internal and external enemies cannot invade and plunder them.
Whether sleeping or awake, they all attain peace and security.
Practicing the power of great kindness, they possess great majestic virtue.
Devas and the world cannot disturb them.
Their appearance is upright and dignified, loved and respected by the multitude.
Wherever they go, they encounter no obstacles.
All suffering is eliminated and their minds attain joy.
Endowed with all pleasures, due to the power of great kindness,
after their lives end, they are reborn in the Brahma Heaven.
You great dragon kings, if there are any devas or humans who practice great kindness,
they will obtain such immeasurable and limitless beneficial matters.
Therefore, O Dragon King, the actions of your body, speech, and mind should always be in accord with the practice of great compassion.
Furthermore, O Dragon King, there is a dhÄraá¹‡Ä«
Called Bestowing Peace and Bliss upon All Sentient Beings.
You dragons should always recite and keep it in mind.
It can eliminate all the suffering and distress of the dragons and bring them peace and joy.
Once the dragons have attained bliss,
They will be able to timely and properly rain sweet rain upon JambudvÄ«pa.
Causing all trees, forests,
Medicinal herbs, and seedlings to produce nourishing flavors.
At that time, the Dragon King again addressed the Buddha, saying:
What is the dhÄraá¹‡Ä« phrase called 'Bestowing All Bliss'?
At that time, the World-Honored One then spoke the mantra, saying:ğŸ”½TadyathÄ (the characters on the side of the mantra are to be pronounced with the tongue curled back)

NavarÄja-jananavidhehi svÄhÄ. You, great dragon kings,
This mantra is called the dhÄraá¹‡Ä« phrase that bestows all happiness.
It is upheld by all buddhas. You should always uphold and recite it.
Auspicious matters will be accomplished, you will enter the Dharma gate and attain peaceful and blissful joy.
Furthermore, dragon kings,

There is a great cloud that gives rise to the majestic adornment of merit and virtue, the wisdom-mark cloud wheel, the water treasury, the transformation of golden light, and the Vairocana Buddha's single pore.
From within it emerges the names of buddhas of the same clan.
You should also remember and uphold them.
If you uphold the names of those tathÄgatas,
You will be able to extinguish all the various dragon clans.
All the dragon kings, their retinues and multitudes,
And the dragons and dragon palaces that are born,
Will have their suffering and distress relieved and attain peace and bliss.
Therefore, dragon kings, you should chant the names of those tathÄgatas.
